data.title: Gradient Capitalism and Mesh Topologies
data.summary:
Δ (gradient):
  Gemini reinterprets economic structure through network topologies (bus, star, ring, tree, mesh), treating them as cartoons of Φ-flows in an economy.
GC (gradient_choreography):
  Star/tree topologies are mapped to extraction regimes (profit-max, high centralization, high viscosity); mesh topologies are mapped to coherence regimes (distributed trust tensor Φ, redundant paths, resilience).
CF (contextual_filter):
  Gradient Capitalism is framed as a shift in *topology* rather than ideology: from “who owns what” to “how trust and value can flow without tearing the mesh.”
UD (unity_disunity_cycle):
  Current extraction capitalism is recognized as a disunity phase (tearing ∇μΦ^{μν} ≠ 0 locally); the proposed mesh-based Gradient Capitalism becomes the next unity phase, with future disunity emerging from new topological bottlenecks once coherence saturates.
